overview:
Founded by Emmy-award winning producer Kevin Wall and headed by company president and co-executive producer Aaron Grosky, Control Room is the worldâ€™s leading producer of massive global events leveraging unparalleled expertise to deliver once-in-a-life time entertainment experiences to audiences around the world.Â  Through a combination of expertise â€“ event production, television production, media architecture design, artist and celebrity relationships, sponsorship development, and creative vision â€“ Control Room evolves events into cultural phenomena.

Control Room is an end-to-end solution for brands, artists, broadcasters and sponsors committed to connecting global audiences with compelling entertainment.Â  The company has built long-standing business relationships and successfully navigated the complexities of culture, government, and production in countries in every region of the world.Â  Since 2005, Control Room has illustrated a history of measurable results through a comprehensive body of work including more than 100 live events ranging from single-artist concerts to worldwide movements.

Control Room has produced and distributed more than 80 live music events including, Madonna, Elton John, John Legend, Pussycat Dolls, and many more. Producing nearly 40 live music shows per year, Control Room delivers the high quality productions with 8-10 camera shoots.

In 2007, Control Room produced the largest entertainment event in history, Live Earth. On July 7, 2007, the 7-continent, 24 hour music extravaganza raised awareness for the Climate Crisis with a message of solutions and personal responsibility. Featuring 150 of the worldâ€™s leading artists, and produced with the highest quality technology, Control Room constructed the most comprehensive media architecture ever, including more than 100 television networks, 100 radio networks world-wide, online through MSNâ€™s 42-global networks in 21 languages and through wireless networks, to deliver the concerts to audiences around the world.
